title: Necessity of Making Your Plans Flexible Enough
body:
![images (7).jpeg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmW2cuRMPTtffNvFKXqNz31veqWz94TYfz1B3z7meCT6UM/images%20(7).jpeg)

Having  some hearty discussion with one of my lecturer and mentor today, I was put through some lessons of life. During the course of discussion, he revealed to me some major ingredient of success he had always adopted and has been giving him positive outcome in his life. 

Some of the point stated are; 

* Never live your day without any specific plan.

* While mapping out a plan for your life, make sure it is a plan in line with your career.

* Let your daily plans be flexible enough because when you make rigid plans, life might pose it's own plan on yours 

* Think of the biblical saying "never plan for what you'll eat tomorrow, let tomorrow take care of itself"

____

Moral: I'm not  saying you shouldn't make plans but while planning, think about the dynamism of life and make provisions for whatever unforeseen occurrences that life might pose to you. 
___
root_title: Necessity of Making Your Plans Flexible Enough

title: Quit Pleasing People... Do Things That Pleases You
body:
![IMG_20180219_234036_985.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmeM8kTygaMxT98yXg7zFSg8sgJgnGaNctWd2P9zTSwozE/IMG_20180219_234036_985.jpg)
At times we spend so much time trying to please people,  we spend lots and lots of time impressing them but recently I got to realize the only set of people that should be in your life are those that really love you for who you are, irrespective of who you are. 
A friend once said

> You can only control your actions, you can't determine people's reaction - Ifeoluwa Fatoki

So the question now is "why try to go out of your own way of live to please people when it is possible that your actions might not be bring a pleasant reaction?" 

I'm not saying you shouldn't try to improve yourself or some attitude, all I'm saying is; if you feel you need a change of attitude let the change be for yourself alone with no intent of pleasing or satisfying people. It is good to emulate characters that you feel will further better your life but not characters you feel will portray you as good

Life is good, but it can be better. 

Life is good.
But imagine waking up one day with empty pockets. Or waking up on an empty stomach to see an empty pot. 

Life goes from good to bad, in an instant. 

Then you get on the media, and more bad, than good news surface.

But in all of this, we can yet carve out a niche of happiness for ourselves.

And to gain perspectives of happiness, we must keep the future in sight.

If we can always remind ourselves of the future we dream of, and work to build, we can sure be motivated to move on from the bad happenings.

Remember, that the key to your happiness lies with you!

And how you choose to see things, determines how happy you end up.
